verses.verse: Then <S%H347>Job<s%> <S%H6030>answered<s%> and <S%H559>said,<s%>
I have <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H428>such<s%> things: <S%H5999>miserable<s%> <S%H5162>comforters<s%> are you <S%H3605>all.<s%>
Shall <S%H7307>vain<s%> <S%H1697>words<s%> have an <S%H7093>end?<s%> <S%H176>or<s%> <S%H4100>what<s%> <S%H4834>emboldens<s%> you that you <S%H6030>answer?<s%>

I <S%H1571>also<s%> could <S%H1696>speak<s%> as you do: <S%H3863>if<s%> your <S%H5315>soul<s%> were in my <S%H5315>soul's<s%> <S%H8478>stead,<s%> I could <S%H2266>heap<s%> up <S%H4405>words<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> you, and <S%H5128>shake<s%> my <S%H7218>head<s%> at you.
But I would <S%H553>strengthen<s%> you with my <S%H6310>mouth,<s%> and the <S%H5205>moving<s%> of my <S%H8193>lips<s%> should <S%H2820>assuage<s%> your grief.
<S%H518>Though<s%> I <S%H1696>speak,<s%> my <S%H3511>grief<s%> is not <S%H2820>assuaged:<s%> and though I <S%H2308>forbear,<s%> <S%H4100>what<s%> am I <S%H1980>eased?<s%>
But <S%H6258>now<s%> he has made me <S%H3811>weary:<s%> you have made <S%H8074>desolate<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> my <S%H5712>company.<s%>

And you have <S%H7059>filled<s%> me with <S%H7059>wrinkles,<s%> which is a <S%H5707>witness<s%> against me: and my <S%H3585>leanness<s%> <S%H6965>rising<s%> up in me <S%H6030>bears<s%> <S%H6030>witness<s%> to my <S%H6440>face.<s%>

He <S%H2963>tears<s%> me in his <S%H639>wrath,<s%> who <S%H7852>hates<s%> me: he <S%H2786>gnashes<s%> on me with his <S%H8127>teeth;<s%> my <S%H6862>enemy<s%> <S%H3913>sharpens<s%> his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> on me.

They have <S%H6473>gaped<s%> on me with their <S%H6310>mouth;<s%> they have <S%H5221>smitten<s%> me on the <S%H3895>cheek<s%> <S%H2781>reproachfully;<s%> they have <S%H4390>gathered<s%> themselves <S%H3162>together<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> me.
<S%H410>God<s%> has <S%H5462>delivered<s%> me to the <S%H5760>ungodly,<s%> and <S%H3399>turned<s%> me <S%H5921>over<s%> <S%H413>into<s%> the <S%H3027>hands<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>

I was at <S%H7961>ease,<s%> but he has <S%H6565>broken<s%> me asunder: he has also <S%H247>taken<s%> me by my <S%H6203>neck,<s%> and <S%H6327>shaken<s%> me to pieces, and <S%H6965>set<s%> me up for his <S%H4307>mark.<s%>

His <S%H7228>archers<s%> <S%H5437>compass<s%> me <S%H5437>round<s%> about, he <S%H6398>splits<s%> my <S%H3629>reins<s%> asunder, and does not <S%H2550>spare;<s%> he <S%H8210>pours<s%> out my <S%H4845>gall<s%> on the <S%H776>ground.<s%>
He <S%H6555>breaks<s%> me with <S%H6556>breach<s%> on <S%H6556>breach,<s%> he <S%H7323>runs<s%> on me like a <S%H1368>giant.<s%>
I have <S%H8609>sewed<s%> <S%H8242>sackcloth<s%> on my <S%H1539>skin,<s%> and <S%H5953>defiled<s%> my <S%H7161>horn<s%> in the <S%H6083>dust.<s%>
My <S%H6440>face<s%> is <S%H2560>foul<s%> with <S%H1065>weeping,<s%> and <S%H5921>on<s%> my <S%H6079>eyelids<s%> is the <S%H6757>shadow<s%> of <S%H6757>death;<s%>
Not for any <S%H2555>injustice<s%> in my <S%H3709>hands:<s%> also my <S%H8605>prayer<s%> is <S%H2134>pure.<s%>
O <S%H776>earth,<s%> <S%H3680>cover<s%> not you my <S%H1818>blood,<s%> and let my <S%H2201>cry<s%> <S%H1961>have<s%> <S%H408>no<s%> <S%H4725>place.<s%>
<S%H1571>Also<s%> <S%H6258>now,<s%> <S%H2009>behold,<s%> my <S%H5707>witness<s%> is in <S%H8064>heaven,<s%> and my <S%H7717>record<s%> is on <S%H4791>high.<s%>
My <S%H7453>friends<s%> <S%H3887>scorn<s%> me: but my <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H1811>pours<s%> out tears to <S%H433>God.<s%>
O that one might <S%H3198>plead<s%> for a <S%H1397>man<s%> with <S%H433>God,<s%> as a <S%H120>man<s%> pleads for his <S%H7453>neighbor!<s%>
<S%H3588>When<s%> a <S%H4557>few<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> are <S%H857>come,<s%> then I shall <S%H1980>go<s%> the <S%H734>way<s%> from where I shall not <S%H7725>return.<s%>
